title: Civil service shake-up: Rewiring the government machine or blowing a fuse?
description: Can Dominic Cummings succeed in shaking up the way civil servants deliver on the PM's promises?

title: My Money: 'Hollie thinks she spent less than me'
description: Jay and Hollie from Liverpool take us through their week's spending.

title: Italian family fosters Gambian migrant: 'The son we never had'
description: When Gambian orphan Muhammed Sanneh arrived in Sicily aged 16, his life took an unexpected turn.

title: Idles: 'We'd love to do a zorb gig'
description: The Bristol punks talk "mental" live shows, class warfare and "violent-toned" new music.

title: University entrance: The ‘taboo’ about who doesn’t go
description: How have white working-class boys been so left behind in getting university places?

title: Six the musical: From a bedroom to Broadway (almost)
description: The musical Six was pulled just hours before its New York debut because of Covid-19.

title: Photography award winners show the fragility and beauty of mangrove forests
description: The Mangrove Photography Award winners show the beauty and fragility of the unique ecosystems.

title: University students: Tips and tricks to help you cope in a pandemic
description: From embracing awkward Zoom chats to persevering with annoying flatmates, experts give some advice.

title: California wildfires: The inmates training to be firefighters
description: Brandon Smith is a former inmate firefighter and now helps former prisoners find jobs in the fire service.

title: Female street artists: 'People assume I’m not the artist'
description: Rosie is passionate about brightening our cities but she says she's faced sexist views on the streets.

title: Cambridge's Dutch-style roundabout: Why all the fuss?
description: Why is this traffic feature so controversial - and where is next in line for one?

title: Coronavirus: ‘I used to film weddings but now I film funerals’
description: Ian Wilkinson has filmed more than 100 services since April.

title: Sir David Attenborough: Naturalist gives Prince George a fossil at royal screening
description: Sir David presented Prince George with a fossilised shark tooth at a screening of his new programme.

title: Amy Coney Barrett: Who is Trump's Supreme Court pick?
description: A favourite of social conservatives, Judge Barrett would swing the highest US court further right.

title: Megan Thee Stallion: What do we know about the rapper's alleged shooting?
description: The rapper says she was shot in the feet by fellow artist Tory Lanez, who denies the accusation.

title: Sparks fly during police chase in Los Angeles
description: Watch what happened when California Police tried to to pull over a speeding pick-up truck.

title: Coronavirus: More than a quarter of UK under stricter rules
description: More parts of south Wales and northern England see local lockdown restrictions start this weekend.

title: Covid outbreak: Manchester Metropolitan University students in lockdown
description: Students at a Manchester university said "police and security were outside" and morale was low.

title: Dennis Skinner: Song about ex-MP tops Amazon download charts
description: A song about the ex-MP has topped the best-seller charts ahead of Kylie Minogue and Bruce Springsteen.

title: NHS Covid-19: App users unable to input negative tests
description: Users in England who booked a test outside of the app can only register a positive result.

title: Best women's cricketers of past decade - as picked by BBC Sport readers
description: Who did you vote for as the best women's players since 2010? And which player made it on to the list twice?

title: Lebanon's PM-designate Adib fails to form new government after blast
description: The previous cabinet resigned in August amid angry calls for reform after the Beirut port explosion.

title: Tasmania pilot whales: Rescuers release 108 surviving animals
description: Efforts now turn to the disposal of some 350 whale carcasses after Australia's worst ever stranding.

title: EasyJet 'hanging by a thread', says union official
description: The airline disputes the claims made in a leaked recording obtained by the BBC.

title: The Papers: Suspect in police shooting 'on terror watch list'
description: The death of a Metropolitan Police officer in south London leads many of Saturday's newspapers.

title: Seven detained after knife attack near ex-Charlie Hebdo offices
description: Two people were seriously wounded near the former offices of satirical French magazine Charlie Hebdo.

title: Coronavirus: Shoppers lost £100m in vouchers expiring in lockdown - Which?
description: A quarter of people had vouchers that expired when shops were shut, a survey by Which? suggests.

title: The day Brexit hit boiling point
description: Former MPs and ministers tell the story of 25 September 2019 - one of Parliament's most dramatic days.

title: Covid-19: What do scientists think of the PM's plan?
description: The new coronavirus restrictions have been met with mixed reviews.

title: What's in Boris Johnson's climate in tray?
description: The PM promises he won't be caught "lagging" on green polices.
